statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: UNLV 80, Colorado State 72
article.story: FORT COLLINS, Colo. (AP) -- Louis Amundson scored six of his 22 points in the final minute and Jo'Van Adams added 21 points to lead UNLV to an 80-72 victory over Colorado State on Saturday. Amundson, 8-for-16 shooting, broke a 72-72 tie with a driving layup with 54 seconds left for UNLV (14-10, 8-4 Mountain West Conference), then converted four free throw attempts after Colorado State missed shots. The Rebels ended a two-game losing streak and beat Colorado State (13-12, 2-10) for the sixth straight time. They dominate the series 23-7. Jason Smith, who scored Colorado State's last points with a jumper with a minute and six seconds left, led the Rams with 24 points and 12 rebounds. Michael Harrison had 16 points and Freddy Robinson had 14 points for the Rams, who attempted to put together back-to-back wins for the first time since Dec. 28 and 30. Colorado State did make a game of it after Amundson's short jumper put UNLV ahead 49-37 five minutes into the second half. The Rams picked up the tempo, forcing four turnovers and Harrison put them up 64-63 with 5:57 remaining. But Adams, who had 17 of his points after halftime, had a 3-pointer and converted two free throws to give the Rebels the lead, 72-70. Smith tied it at 72 with a soft jumper with 2:21 left, but Colorado State never scored again, missing its last four shots. UNLV led 39-31 at the half, but not before eight lead changes and a layup by Jason Smith had the game tied at 19-19. Amundson scored seven of the next nine points to put the Rebels ahead 28-21 and then Curtis Terry connected on two jumpers late in the half to make it 39-29.
